newsitem.title: USA: Sony's Pearl Jam takes top spot with album.
newsitem.headline: Sony's Pearl Jam takes top spot with album.

text.p: Pearl Jam's fourth album, "No Code," on Sony Corp's Epic Records label, opened at the top of the U.S. album sales charts with sales of almost 367,000, a spokeswoman for the band's label said Wednesday.

By the group's standards, this is a disappointing figure, as their previous album "Vitalogy" reached Number One with first week sales of 877,000 units in 1994. Their album from the year before, "Vs.," holds the first week sales record of 950,000. However, both were helped by coming out just before Christmas.
A spokeswoman for Epic said "we are extremely pleased" with Pearl Jam's sales, but declined further comment. The band is preparing for its U.S. tour, which begins Sept. 16 in Seattle.

Retailers said the industry seems to be in a malaise, and they noted that one of the top selling records this year has been one that was released more than a year ago, Alanis Morissette's "Jagged Little Pill."
"Music is so stale this year, it's unbelievable," said Bob Say, owner of the Moby Disc chain in southern California. He added, "We did OK with 'No Code,' but we didn't do great with it."
